item.title: Data Analytics Architect
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Data Analytics Architect

Job Description

RBC is a digitally-enabled relationship bank. We strive to engage our customers when, how and where it’s most convenient and to provide a highly-personalized experience. We also collaborate broadly with innovative business and technology partners to create a platform and ecosystem that can bring even more value to our customers. We care deeply about the success of our customers and communities.

We’re looking for an experienced solution architect who is passionate about our mission to join the RBC Digital team. We want vocal futurists that can advocate their vision, who will be excited about creative problem-solving as part of a cross-functional team with customer focus and will strive for the best end-user experience in addition to having the drive and desire to keep learning the latest architecture developments, standards and techniques.

The primary focus of this position is to provide technology and architectural leadership with respect to the design and delivery of highly-scalable customer data and insights solutions leveraging machine learning (ML) and artificial intelligence (AI) platforms.

This work will support development and delivery of information-intensive initiatives based on common practices for multiple complex projects.


What will you do?

  • Collaborate with business leaders to determine how to best apply technology to enable growth and success (e.g. scalable domain-driven solutions, operational reporting, SRE practices)
  • Provide architectural strategic thinking, information solutions, and input into roadmaps to drive delivery
  • Ensure architectural compliance of solutions and introduce recommendations for changes to reference model(s) when needed.
  • Maintain a plan to address gaps between current and target state architectures
  • Participate in \'reuse, buy and build\' decisions.
  • Understand potential impacts of proposed solutions on other systems, processes and/or projects
  • Articulate and document designs, considering trade-offs, costs, and benefits
  • Develop ongoing knowledge of current and emerging technologies
  • Identify new and emerging solutions, assess relevance and potential value to the organization, and present findings to teammates and management.
  • Participate in day-to-day execution of the architecture strategy
  • Develop blueprints and conduct design reviews to ensure architectural compliance of solutions.
  • Work across multiple projects and systems to develop, communicate, and mentor others on solution design, implementation and operation patterns and best practices

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Background in data architecture, analytics, and cloud native solutions
  • Experience with analysis techniques and measurement tools to continuously build valuable insights and business recommendations.
  • Strategic mindset with strong change management, continuous improvement and transformation skills
  • Strong technical skills in application development (data pipelines, services, streaming platforms)
  • Knowledge of identity and data access management and security best practices
  • Working knowledge in data acquisition, data storage & computational patterns with industry standard tools
  • Experience supporting mission-critical applications in production
  • Software engineering skills with distributed computing background and proven experience in delivering large-scale data platforms.
  • Good understanding of data fabric/mesh concepts and semantic layers

Nice to have:

  • Business or product leadership experience
  • Hands-on working experience with cloud native solution such as SnowFlake, DataBricks, Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue/Lamba, RedShift, Azure DW.
  • Experience with next generation solution delivery on technologies such as Python, Kafka, Spark, Apigee, Jenkins; container solutions including Docker/Kubernetes; and private cloud platforms such as Openshift (OCP) or Pivotal (PCF)
  • Exposure to building and deploying predictive and prescriptive analytics models using any of the following: Python SciKit, R and Pytorch.
  • Experience with Salesforce (CRM), Salesforce Marketing Cloud (SFMC) and/or Palintir Foundry

What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Member of the front-end chapter, which provides training, events, and other opportunities for learning. You will also have an opportunity to share your work and experience with your peers

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options​

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Sr. Manager, Marketing Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Marketing Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Decision Analytics and Business Intelligence team at RBC collaborates with product groups, channel partners and marketing across the Canadian Banking and Insurance platforms to help drive business results by developing optimized marketing solutions enabled through business and marketing analysis. The opportunity is for a Senior Manager on the Marketing Analytics team.    

This role requires both a highly specialized, technical skill-set and an agile mindset with the ability to think creatively to solve complex problems. The successful candidate will be able to combine strong business acumen with technical expertise in order to use data in strategic storytelling and provide insights and recommendations to our business partners.

What will you do?

  • Manage the portfolio of analyses required for our partners in Cards, Payments and Banking to meet their business and financial imperatives; prioritize and pivot as needed to accommodate changing analytical needs
  • Deliver actionable, accurate and thorough marketing campaign, channel and client offer optimization analytics to help the business meet its priorities
  • Lead a team of analytics managers with day to day coaching, prioritization and oversight of their activities for a high quality delivery
  • Interact with senior business and marketing leaders to understand the business and marketing objectives in order to define and conduct analytics to meet these objectives
  • End-to-end responsibility for analyses including framing and negotiating analytical objectives with senior leaders, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analyses and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in timely and effective manner
  • Identify revenue enhancing and cost saving opportunities while ensuring relevant insights are being applied to evolve strategies
  • Apply experimental design, test and learn methodologies and perform statistical analyses (significance tests, segmentation, regression, decision tree, etc.) where needed to optimize strategies
  • Develop new methods and techniques to analyze a variety of marketing programs like acquisition, growth, retention, cross-sell, media, triggers, online and transformational initiatives
  • Use impact and influence to manage

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline preferred
  • 2+ years of team management experience
  • 5+ years of experience in an analytical database marketing or related role working closely with internal business partners
  • Proficient technical knowledge with very large relational databases and with tools such as SQL, SAS and Python
  • 3+ years of SAS programming experience
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Expertise in design of experiment and business casing
  • Expertise in campaign analytics and application of statistical evaluation techniques
  • Strong problem solving skills and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management
  • Previous dashboard report development is an asset
  • Knowledge of Personal and Business banking accounts, Rewards and loyalty analytics

item.title: Analytics Lead
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Lead

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission.

What is the opportunity?

About Ventures Analytics

The Venture/Enterprise Analytics team solves strategic problems across the organization using a data-driven approach. We leverage data to unlock opportunities, influence strategy, assess the impact of business tactics and make relevant recommendations to the individual ventures, internal or external partners. Our team has seen massive growth since last year, and have provided tremendous value across RBC Ventures teams and RBC Lines of Business (LOB). In 2022, our priority is to expand the team to scale our services and provide opportunities for new team members.

What will you do?

  • Collaborate with Ventures and/or RBC’s external partners to understand core business goals and help achieve results through a data driven approach.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, dashboarding, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Develop strong relationships with your stakeholders to achieve superior business results and long lasting impact.
  • Communicate approaches & insights effectively to influence decision making at senior leadership levels.

What do you need to succeed?

Business acumen, curiosity, good communication, and strong technical skills.

Must have

  • 5+ years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Data Science, Consulting).
  • Fluent in SQL (for analyses & creating reports) and predictive analytics in R or Python. 
  • Experience communicating analytics and Machine Learning results back to business partners and/or C-level.
  • An eager listener and a team player who is comfortable forming cross functional relationships with our partners.
  • We like to have fun and work with people who are passionate about analytics. We are looking for someone who thrives in a diverse and inclusive culture.

Nice to Have

  • Experience in improving business processes using ML is a big plus.
  • Experience publishing reports/dashboards, and visualizations with Tableau is a plus.
  • Leadership experience (in direct and/or indirect reporting capacity).
  • University degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., statistics, economics, analytics)

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits
  • The opportunity to learn about the business models of a variety of ventures and RBC external partners
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in an agile, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • The opportunity to interface with senior level executives from many different parts of the organization

VSANALYTICS

RBC Ventures

item.title: Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Analytics Developer

Job Description

What will you do? 
Refactor and consolidate analytics-related functionality.
Design robust API’s around common pieces of functionality, refactoring the code to support these new APIs, retire legacy code, and ensure that structural problems are also addressed during the refactoring.
Investigate and fix stability problems, determine what the fundamental solution should be, and prioritize accordingly.
Identify and address gaps in test coverage.
Interface with vendor systems, expose analytics to Excel and Risk systems.
Proposes the design and implementation of strategic analytics API’s.
Analyze and fix performance and stability problems in the internal analytics layers.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have:
Strong command of C++, Python or Java.
Expert in algorithms and data structures, object orientation, design patterns, and functional programming paradigms.
Excellent problem solving and quantitative skills.
Excellent API design, refactoring, profiling and code optimization skills.
Experience as a senior developer or team lead.

Nice to have:
Expertise with designing and supporting financial analytics API’s.
Experience with databases, distributed cache products, distributed and multithreaded computation, big data processing technologies such as Spark.
Experience with multiple platforms (Windows, Linux), compilers and tools for C++ development.
Experience with .Net.
Experience with build/test/release infrastructure.

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work
Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities   
Access to a variety of job opportunities across businesses and geographies

Job Summary

What is the opportunity?

As an Analytics Developer, you will develop our analytics infrastructure to make it more flexible, reliable, and performant. This role requires cooperation, coordination with quant, trading, and IT groups. You possess strong programming and API design skills.

Previous projects with low latency or high throughput analytics, and interest in financial products across asset classes would be preferred, but isn’t necessary.

item.title: Manager, CRM Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, CRM Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is hiring an exciting Manager, CRM Analytics role. In this role, you will work closely with members of the CRM Analytics team and collaborate with various partners including the Lines of Business across Personal and Commercial Banking providing actionable insights and developing solutions that enhance the client experience and drive value for the business.

What will you do?

  • Examine and evaluate all facets of the marketing leads conversion process in order to produce key findings and recommendations that augment offer fulfillments
  • Analyze utilization of Outbound resources to optimize marketing opportunities for individual campaigns
  • Analyze Call Centre and Branch Inbound client interaction sessions to enhance actioning and fulfilling of product and service offers
  • Conduct marketing contact channel analyses to provide pertinent information and proposals supporting Client Interaction Strategy to enhance client experience and drive business values
  • Develop dashboards and monitor performance of various marketing channels to ensure client interactions are uniquely managed in the constantly evolving environment
  • Deliver insightful and actionable analytics to underpin the Client Growth initiative enabling client acquisition and retention across all lines of business
  • End-to-end responsibility for campaign analyses including framing of analytical objectives with partners, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analyses and presenting key insights to stakeholders in timely and effective manner
  • Provide analytical support in other associated client and marketing initiatives

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Proficient technical knowledge with very large relational databases and with tools such as SAS and SQL
  • Sound business acumen and strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
  • Strong problem solving skill and ability to conceptualize strategy
  • Demonstrated ability to work well collaboratively in a cross function environment as well as independently with initiative taking ownership

Nice-to-have:

  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of marketing, product management, sales, finance, pricing and risk management
  • Experience with Hadoop and Google Analytics

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • An opportunity to influence the strategic direction of the enterprise
  • An opportunity to work closely with RBC’s senior leaders
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive and high performing culture

item.title: Trading Analytics Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Trading Analytics Developer

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Capital Markets Technology, Equities group is seeking a Senior Software Developer to work on a Risk & Execution Services Applications supporting the Equity Derivatives trading desks. The platform stores risk analytics generated by a proprietary valuation engine and makes them available through a variety of interfaces to Traders. The applications also involve saving market data, running reports and analysis to serve the trading desk.

What will you do?

  • Work as a member of a global team to build Technology solutions used across the Equity and Equity Derivatives trading desks (Flow, DLO, STP, CED, CASH).
  • Create UI and interact with user to create the best user experience
  • Work with Capital Market UI Framework (React JS, Javascript, python)
  • Create Data providers to source data from various services (C#, python) to feed the UI
  • Design, develop, and maintain reusable Python, C# data loading, extracts and transformations.
  • Transition existing UIs into the new one
    • Back-End: C#/python – Docker/K8s deployment
    • Front-End: Web Application
  • Create Services and Rest endpoints for application
  • Work with Traders on daily applications and Implement solutions for their asks
  • Check-In code under source control (github/svn)
  • Create Build and Deployment Script (shell) on Jenkins
  • Scripts to source control Git/Docker/K8s

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 3+ Years of Experience in Web Front-End Development (Javascript, React JS)
  • 3+ Years of Experience in Python
  • 3+ Years of OOO Development (Java, C#)
  • Experience with of UI/UX Styling
  • Knowledge of Database (SQL, Indexing, clustering, performance)
  • Knowledge of distributed architectures
  • Knowledge and understanding of Equity Derivatives
  • Experience with DevOps (Jenkins, etc)
  • Experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Swarm
  • Experience with REST, RPC, IDL
  • Understanding of Equity Derivatives and Risk frameworks
  • Basic understanding of Equity Derivatives Pricing, Greeks and Risk
  • Basic knowledge of statistical analysis (time series, linear regression)
  • Ability to adapt and learn new languages and Technology
  • Team work, ability collaboration with other groups/teams

Nice-to-have

  • Strong analytical and problem solving skills; ability to work in fast-paced environments delivering quality solutions
  • Excellent written and spoken communication skills
  • Experience with C#

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, on progressive thinking to keep growing, and on working together to deliver trusted advice to our clients and help communities prosper.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with business stakeholders.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Manager, Reporting & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting & Analytics

Job Description

  • The Manager, Reporting & Analytics will work within Operations to develop, design, implement and manage executive reporting that supports Data Centre Infrastructure & Strategy (DCIS) strategic priorities. In addition, the incumbent will also guide and shape strategic choices of the Senior Management team by building out the reporting and analytic ecosystem, delivering ad-hoc analytics and be a subject matter data expert.
  • Drive business results by the design, development and production of insightful Executive reporting that aligns with, and supports DCIS strategic priorities.
  • Leverage financial acumen to synthesize and distil key information to enable faster Senior Management decision making and assists in the establishment of action plans to maximize business performance.
  • Provide expert support and analyses around Apptio deep dive requests resulting from stakeholder enquiries. Sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.
  • Deliver complete, accurate and timely reporting of contracts, financials and audit & risk activities to enable the business to meet their short and long term goals.
  • Interact with senior leadership to understand their objectives in order to continue to evolve and maximize effectiveness and align reporting and analytics to meet those objectives.
  • Investigate industry trends and organization knowledge to provide alternative reporting approaches/solutions (ex. dashboards, graphical visualizations) that will drive performance to improve insights and analytics across Operations
  • Review and leverage internal and external data/information to provide insights and context around impactful/actionable/controllable business performance opportunities through the use of key performance indicators

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.description:

Business Analyst, Loyalty Analytics

What is the opportunity?

In this role, you will be responsible for providing business insights within the Loyalty analytics team. You will serve as a dedicated analytics partner that frames the output of analytical reports to inform strategic and tactical decision making. You will have the opportunity to facilitate the design and development of analytical products & roadmaps, and working closely with the partnership team, support partner relationships with data related requests.

What will you do?

item.title: Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Fraud Research and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Fraud Management (FM) teams employ deep subject matter expertise in identifying, assessing, mitigating and controlling fraud risks for the Enterprise.  Within Fraud Management, the Fraud Data Science & Analytics (FDSA) team develops and optimizes fraud detection strategies to maximize operational effectiveness and minimize client impact. The FDSA Research and Analytics function  conducts analytic research into fraud issues identifying  causation and correlation, develop insights on emerging trends, gaps or systemic issues, and collaborate with Fraud Management partners to communicate results and take action.

Please Note: While the work arrangement for this opportunity is primarily remote, you may be required to periodically attend an approved RBC office location.

What will you do?

  • Identify patterns, trends and hidden causation and correlation relationships from Fraud data and advise FM SMT of emerging trends, specific gaps or systemic issues that impact the Fraud Risk of RBC
  • Collaborate with appropriate partners for action, correction, awareness and training
  • Forecast Financials and Fraud KPI’s using predictive analytics techniques and generate insights for executive decision making and communicating results through insightful visualizations, white papers, reports and presentations
  • Research business problems, develop solutions to support investigation and analysis and lead progression of analytics methodology, tools and measurement to create development templates for automation
  • Build the foundation of information in consolidated data repositories for Operations, Fraud Events, Fraud Performance and Financials
  • Provide a complete picture of the fraud landscape with drill-down capabilities for root cause analysis and deliver self-serve interactive visualizations through accessible platforms like Tableau
  • Conduct Code Reviews and develop standards for Development practices and partner with project teams to support information required for analysis of the current state
  • Deliver Project Reporting for Fraud Events, Performance, Operational and Financial KPI’s and KRI’s and Program Benefits measurements to track success criteria of the Project Business Case

What do you need to succeed?

  • 2+ years’ experience in a Data science and analytics
  • Advanced capability in using Python, R, PySpark, SAS, SQL and Tableau
  • Experience with Databases and Data Structures (RDBMS, Hadoop etc.)
  • Ability to apply data and analytics concepts to business problems and explain business value of data and analytics concepts
  • Ability to multi-task and prioritize and complete projects effectively and in a timely manner
  • Strong team player with a track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team
  • Professional verbal and written communication and presentation skills, and ability to provide consultation, analysis, and recommendations on a broad range of projects in a deadline driven environment with ambiguity
  • Good understanding of Canadian Financial Institutions, with a focus on Fraud/Risk Operations

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, computer science, software engineering or related quantitative field

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Fair compensation
  • Challenging work in a fast-paced timeline driven work environment
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 
  • Work with a great and supportive team

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Senior Manager - Distribution Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager - Distribution Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

In alignment with RBC’s collective ambition to “Win as One RBC”, the role of the Senior Manager – Distribution Analytics supports the Senior Director – Distribution Analytics in their ability to execute P&CB Regional Banking strategy and drive achievement of in-year objectives.

The Distribution Analytics team collaborates with product/channel groups, Regional Banking leaders and teams across Canadian Banking National Office to help drive business results by providing relevant and timely analysis and insights supporting both Retail and Business areas. You will work directly with Regional Banking leadership to develop, design, implement and manage a portfolio of analysis to support transformation initiatives by leveraging RBC’s suite of analytical tools. In addition, you will also deliver insights to help guide and shape strategic choices across the Regional Banking ecosystem, deliver ad-hoc analytics, and be a subject matter data expert (including leveraging data partnerships across multiple teams).

What will you do?

  • Drive business results by informing and influencing business strategies through the application of data analytics to drive insights. Collaborate with regions, business lines and channel partners to ensure optimization and strategic insights from analysis and data are applied to evolve Regional Banking channel and business strategies.  Strategies impacted can range from routine performance reporting to transformational initiatives impacting our banking ecosystem.  Leverage financial acumen to provide transparency and connectivity from activities to financial outcomes.

  • Deliver complete, accurate and timely Regional Banking analytics by channel, role, product, and region that enable the business to meet their short and long term goals.

  • Interact with senior business and regional leadership to understand business and Regional Banking objectives, in order to define and perform analytics to meet those objectives.

  • Responsibility for end-to-end analysis including framing and negotiating analytical objectives with senior leaders, sourcing relevant data, performing in-depth analysis and presenting actionable insights to stakeholders in a timely and effective manner.

  • Respond to ad-hoc reports needed for effective management support and oversight.

  • Investigate available predictive models and segmentation techniques to improve Regional Banking analytics across role, channel, product and region.

  • Review and support business cases and develop analysis plans to ensure analytical requirements are captured and analytical objectives are well understood and meaningful.

What do you need to succeed?

Must have:

  • 5+ years of experience with big data, sales, distribution, financials, business analytics or related roles
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills; Attention to detail, organization, ability to multi task and time management is critical
  • Outstanding business and financial acumen with strong analytical, communication and presentation skills; including the ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Strategic mindset – considerable amount of creative, innovative and analytical thinking, ability to conceptualize strategy, and strong problem solving required
  • Experience in the application of statistical/visualization tools coupled with strong technical skills in (SAS, SQL, Tableau, Excel, PowerPoint) will be preferred capabilities

Nice to have:

  • Familiar with a range of statistical data tools - strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining. (Python, R) preferred but not required.
  • Experience in financial services industry with broad understanding of retail and commercial roles, incentive, sales, distribution, and finance is preferred
  • Master’s degree in quantitative discipline preferred but not required

  

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits, and competitive compensation

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Manages the development, implementation and support of business analytics initiatives and projects. Typically manages 2 or more specialized departments comprised of supervisors, managers, professionals, and/or large numbers of operational support employees.

item.title: Manager, Analytics Implementation & Optimization
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Analytics Implementation & Optimization

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Manager, Analytics Implementation & Optimization will play a key role within Insurance and the Data & Information team by supporting proactive expense management, building expense literacy, providing NIE and cost study analytics, as well as internal business communications support to various areas within RBC Insurance. This role will primarily be responsible for leading and developing a sustainable Expense Hygiene practice within Insurance, and expanding this practice across other RBC platforms, to continually identify opportunities to reduce expenses and build expense management and stewardship as a core competency within the organization.

What will you do?

• Provide day to day operational support and SME advice to all Operations Operating Committee (OOC) members including Operational Effectiveness, Operational Risk, Project Delivery & Digital Transformation, Operational Partnerships and Creditor Operations by enabling leaders to identify expense related knowledge gaps, streamline and promote consistency in expense processes (monthly eDHR and BVR reviews, completing annual NIE and Cost Studies, etc.)

• Leverage data, analytics and ingenuity skills to continually and proactively identify opportunities to reduce unnecessary expenses and work with key business partners across RBCI to execute on the removal of these expenses

• Promote expense literacy and hygiene as a core competency within Insurance and build out processes, resources, tools and practices to promote active expense management

• Leverage best practices from expense hygiene initiatives within Insurance and promote across other RBC platforms (i.e. Wealth Management, Capital Markets, etc.)

• Curate and analyze various expense and HR data sources in order to actively identify cost reduction opportunities, bring these opportunities forward and partner to execute the removal of expenses as well as track, measure and validate expense reduction attributed to expense management efforts across RBC Insurance for Leadership team and Finance

• Partner and collaborate with expense delegates from departments across RBCI to establish and instill expense maintenance into regular activities and partner with Finance to accurately and appropriately track Expense Hygiene initiatives through the Enterprise Efficiency Dashboard

What will you need to succeed?

Must-have:

• University degree or equivalent and 4 to 7 years of operational business experience

• Proven leadership, stakeholder and change management experience within Insurance Industry

• Proven ability to impact and influence and execution excellence skills

• Good understanding of RBC financial reporting, budget planning and sound knowledge of multiple RBCI business platforms

• Strong facilitation, communication and presentation skills using new on-line tools and technology

• Decision making, critical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills

Nice to Have:

• Change Management certification

• Lean Six Sigma certification

• Experience in the Insurance industry

What\'s in it for you?

• Competitive pay and high-earning potential

• All the tools, training, and team support you need to grow your career

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will work closely with Digital Platform Product Owners, LOB Product Owners, Marketing and Sales teams, and Senior Management to structure analyses, uncover analytic insights, develop net new data assets, build dashboards and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

In this role you will be responsible for supporting the end-to-end implementation of the analytics lifecycle - data collection, deep dive insight analytics, reporting and presentations.

You will provide objective, value-added insights and analysis to enable product owners to make strategic data-driven decisions. The person in this role will build critical understanding of RBCs products and the associated client behaviours to help deliver business value. The delivery of business value in this role comes from a combination of knowledge transfer to key stakeholders and the provisioning of data services and tests to client facing applications. 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:

    • Execute analytics plans on large data sets representing the behaviors, demographics and product attribute of prospects and clients. 

    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as causal inference, time series analysis, and hypothesis testing to find actionable insights

    • Develop and test hypotheses on data and data models

    • Based on evidence, make recommendations to leadership and stakeholders to support strategies and drive decisions

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:

    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition

    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions

    • Find, clean and structure data

    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes

  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:

    • Support the creation of Business Intelligence reporting that can be automated using reporting tools

    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance

    • Help construct presentations in story format

    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports and presentations identifying trends, issues and opportunities 

  • Stakeholder Consultancy:

    • Support relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems using a variety of analytical approaches and methodologies.

    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones. Manages stakeholder expectations and keeps them up-to-date with project statuses.

    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • 5+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role

  • Proven analytics and problem solving skills

  • Strong drive and desire to understand relationship of organizational components

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field

  • Advanced experience with SQL, Python, or Scala

  • Knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research.

  • Strong team player with track record of collaboration and experience working as part of an agile team

Nice-to-have

  • Experience with Spark, Scala, Hive, Python is a preferred

  • Good understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue

  • Experienced with Jupyter Notebooks, IntelliJ, Visual Studio Code other notebook environments

  • Experience working in Unix/Linux environments

  • Experience working as part of an agile team using Github and JIRA

  • Experience with digital data collection tools such as Google Analytics

  • Knowledgeable in data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • A world-class training program in financial services

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

Il est possible qu\'ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d\'adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l\'exige

item.title: Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Market Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businesses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

You will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. You will be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required and  should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.  

What will you do?

  • Develop indepth knowledge of the current and strategic reporting infrastructure state
  • Propose, build, and develop tactical and strategic enhancements to the reporting infrastructure
  • Repurpose and rebuild the existing VBA-based reports to the strategic model/infrastructure
  • Enhance Tableau-based reports, and optimise existing reports
  • Co-ordinate project plans, and work with key IT and Risk Management stakeholders to drive deliverables to completion
  • Automate various daily tasks involved in the current reporting infrastructure, including implementation of control frameworks and best-practise checks
  • Provide support to the Risk Managers on day to day running of risk reports
  • Regularly update and clearly communicate progress and milestones with GRM management/users

What do you need to succeed?

 Must-have

  • Strong leadership skills and vision ; proven record of leading a team/project and delivering value-added results
  • Hands on experience working on large datasets and databases
  • Ability to understand and clearly communicated around highly complicated reporting infrastructure dependencies related to books of complex derivatives portfolios
  • Proficient in VBA/Python/SQL
  • Hands-on experience of Tableau
  • Excellent written and oral communication skills ; is able to articulate ideas, thought processes, and recommendations confidently and rationally to senior audiences
  • Relevant experience working with Group Risk Management/Trading at a top-tier financial company
  • Good understanding of the day-to-day responsibilities of Market Risk, and daily risk reporting
  • Preferable knowledge of derivatives and greeks for interest rate and equity option products, Stress testing and scenario analysis and value-at-Risk measurement

What is in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best - progressive thinking to keep growing and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper.  We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses, flexible benefits and competitive compensation
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Opportunities to work with the best in the field
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible working options fully supported.

Job Summary

Group Risk Management (GRM) provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling, and reporting on the nature and extent of all material market risk on the RBC London Trading Floor – ensuring implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures.

We are looking for someone to manage the development and strategic rollout of the reporting infrastructure for Structured Rates and Global Equities businessses. The incumbent will have strong problem solving, analytical and communication skills – and a track-record of delivering infrastructure changes by devising solutions and liaising with key stakeholders towards project completion.

The person will have previous coding experience in Python, VBA, and SQL. The person should be able to write tactical scripts where needed, whilst working with key stakeholders to drive strategic change. Hands on experience with Tableau (or similar) is required. The person should ideally have a basic understanding of financial products and the main risk factors within the interest rate and equity businesses.

item.title: Senior HR Data Governance Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior HR Data Governance Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?
RBC, one of Canada’s largest and most respected employers, is looking for an experienced Sr Manager Data Governance Analytics to join our growing Talent Data and Analytics team. Reporting to the Director, Talent Data Governance,  Sr Manager Data Governance Analytics will be a strong execution lead of all facets of HR data management and governance across the HR domain.  You will lead cross-functional projects, where  root cause analysis and end-to-end data discovery efforts need to be supplemented with strong stakeholder management to ensure the team provides relevant advice and oversight to our HR Centres of Excellence, business partners and other stakeholders through projects, initiatives, and day to day operational activities related to the management and governance of HR data. 

Your quick, problem-solving ability allows you to investigate, analyze, organize and prioritize easily –and is foundational to your success in the role. You are able to keep the big vision in your mind, with an eye on moving parts of a project and quickly assess impact, pivot as needed and redirect the efforts to bring the project to fruition.  Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will also be helpful. You will interface regularly with SMEs from HR Centres of Excellence, the HR Architecture team and the HR Reporting team as well as our partners in IT, Finance, Chief Data Office and Legal.  A key focus for our team and this role in particular is in the proper design of employee data capture processes, to make them more accurate and efficient for employees, managers, and the HR community. 

As the right candidate, you are able to make evidence-backed recommendations to senior leadership and influence decisions, drive projects forward in tight deadlines, and navigate the organization effectively.  You are multifaceted self-starter, fast-paced, comfortable with change and ambiguity, and understand how to apply design thinking and problem solving skills to projects. You are excited by opportunities to optimize our HR data architecture, data governance, and data pipelines. You understand how HR data is increasingly seen as an invaluable asset, and are comfortable collaborating with HR subject matter experts to understand the business requirements.

What will you do?

  • Develop or implementing strategies and processes for data implementation, data acquisition, and archive recovery.
  • Work with business, applications and operations counterparts to ensure data integrity and availability.
  • Resolve data integration and security issues for adherence to the organization\'s quality standards.
  • Understand requirements from businesses to help review, improve and document changes to data definitions, access, usage and management processes
  • Translate business requirements to IT requirement
  • Ensures all data captured is defined and documented.
  • Advise on best practices for data usage/security/retention/collection etc. for various projects related to HR data and analytics
  • Engage in a variety of initiatives supporting  HR operations, and strive to evolve the maturity of the HR Data governance program
  • Work with data infrastructure team, data integration teams etc. to execute on projects
  • Document, manage and execute master data validation strategies for the function
  • Execute analytical audits against a variety of types of HR data to assess data validity and data quality, understand gaps, impact and scope of data issues
  • Collaborate with other departments on data management related projects and reviews.
  • Support an effective governance communication program for the function
  • Build a common repository of HR data knowledge including data dictionaries, dimension and measure definitions, and lineage
  • Summarize and explain data sets and designs, business processes
  • Support the strategic development of the HR Governance Program through research and analytics

What do you need to succeed?

 Must have:

  • 5+ years’ experience in a data-driven environment with a strong understanding of data issues, data management and data governance principles.  
  • Strong business acumen and stakeholder management skills to understand business requirements.  
  • Experience troubleshooting data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
  • Experience designing processes to support data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
  • Extremely strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured and sub-optimized datasets.
  • Strong management and organizational skills
  • Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment
  • Communication and presentation skills: ability to summarize and playback analysis, tailor the content for different audiences (technical and non-technical) to drive to impact and help make data-driven decisions.

Nice-to-have

  • HR/People data domain experience is preferred.
  • Graduate degree demonstrating the ability to research, learn and problem solve.
  • Experience in agile development and design thinking methodologies
  • Superior MS Excel and PowerPoint
  • SQL/MySQL or other data query/analytics capability
  • Comfort with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater scopes of work

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with hiring manager.

​

Job Summary

What is the Opportunity?
RBC, one of Canada’s largest and most respected employers, is looking for an experienced Sr Manager Data Governance Analytics to join our growing Talent Data and Analytics team.
Reporting to the Director, Talent Data Governance, Sr Manager Data Governance Analytics will be a strong execution lead of all facets of HR data management and governance across the HR domain. You will lead cross-functional projects, where root cause analysis and end-to-end data discovery efforts need to be supplemented with strong stakeholder management to ensure the team provides relevant advice and oversight to our HR Centres of Excellence, business partners and other stakeholders through projects, initiatives, and day to day operational activities related to the management and governance of HR data.
Your quick, problem-solving ability allows you to investigate, analyze, organize and prioritize easily –and is foundational to your success in the role. You are able to keep the big vision in your mind, with an eye on moving parts of a project and quickly assess impact, pivot as needed and redirect the efforts to bring the project to fruition. Your strong ability to work with multiple stakeholders and form positive working relationships will also be helpful. You will interface regularly with SMEs from HR Centres of Excellence, the HR Architecture team and the HR Reporting team as well as our partners in IT, Finance, Chief Data Office and Legal. A key focus for our team and this role in particular is in the proper design of employee data capture processes, to make them more accurate and efficient for employees, managers, and the HR community.
As the right candidate, you are able to make evidence-backed recommendations to senior leadership and influence decisions, drive projects forward in tight deadlines, and navigate the organization effectively. You are multifaceted self-starter, fast-paced, comfortable with change and ambiguity, and understand how to apply design thinking and problem solving skills to projects. You are excited by opportunities to optimize our HR data architecture, data governance, and data pipelines. You understand how HR data is increasingly seen as an invaluable asset, and are comfortable collaborating with HR subject matter experts to understand the business requirements.

item.title: Sr Manager, Analytics & Pricing Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr Manager, Analytics & Pricing Insights

Job Description

PURPOSE

  • Provide analysis that supports the formulation of RBC Direct Investing (DI) strategies—to promote leadership in the Direct Investing industry.
  • Support DI’s analytics practice to generate hypotheses (Learn) and monitor (Measure) impact of RBC DI initiatives and the performance of overall business.
  • Employ their expertise in DI systems and products to represent DI in discussions with internal RBC partners and senior leadership.

Primary Responsibilities

Analytics and Reporting

  • Provide analysis and insight used to make key business decisions based on product and transaction data
  • Use analytical tools and develop models that give insights to set strategic direction
  • Create and present regular reporting on key actionable metrics, OKR reporting, for the DI business and provide recommendations for continuous improvement - Refine data collection and reporting by working closely with enterprise data partners.

Strategic and Regulatory Initiatives

  • Delegated as strategy representative on projects involving new products or pricing changes by providing support to digital product owners and operations support team
  • Support Director, Product Strategy & Insights in discussions with compliance, risk and legal in order to understand and mitigate the impact of regulatory changes.
  • Validate and analyze data required for RBC DI’s responses to industry surveys (e.g. market share reporting) and competitive surveys (Globe & Mail; research firms)

Lead analysis and Insights for Product and Pricing Strategy

  • Conduct research of industry and market trends; provide regular updates to management team regarding the impact of these changes on DI Business and product features
  • Recommend and support DI pricing strategies
  • Service Pricing: analyze pricing strategies and rates (fees, commissions, and setting of credit and debit interest rate) through pricing analytics and competitive scanning
  • Pricing models: develop pricing models used for pricing change decisions keeping in mind the evolving market opportunities.
  • Client Offers: gather data and create a client offer model to justify offers and create performance KPIs for campaigns
  • Act as first point of contact for client exceptions based on understanding of profitability and client relationships
  • Support all regular reporting on client and financial insights by facilitating annual strategic planning sessions to drive KPIs for RBC DI business and monitor DI’s performance

JOB REQUIREMENTS

  • Mindset I ability to drive client insights
  • Ability to envision the future and influence long term strategic choices
  • Demonstrated ability to execute on accountabilities
  • Advanced knowledge of wealth management I investments I brokerage
  • Solid understanding of how online brokerages make money with accountability to drive revenue and profitability for the business
  • Strategic/Conceptual thinking and customer insight
  • Advanced knowledge/experience of client data analytics
  • Experience developing and creating written communications
  • Strong verbal communication and presentation skills
  • Impact and influence through partnering and collaboration.
  • Ability to work effectively in cross-functional team.

Required:

  • MBA or Bachelor of Commerce/Business Degree
  • Direct work experience in wealth management I investments I brokerage

Preferred:

  • CFA designation
  • Canadian Securities Course
  • Experience with online businesses or internet-related strategies

Job Summary

A tremendous opportunity to join a dynamic, digital and growing business.
This role provides Direct Investing with business insights and analysis to support strategy creation, ongoing reporting, and measurement. Supports all business decisions and business casing through strong data interrogation and client insights.

item.title: Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling will support the development and monitoring of RBC’s Retail AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data analytics and portfolio management perspective. 

What will you do?

  • Participate in design sessions to provide input, gather and document requirements, and help formulate analytical frameworks to develop effective risk model calibration and reporting that creates robust business intelligence
  • Manage in an iterative manner the creation and improvement upon model monitoring and regulatory reporting processes and data
  • Lead, as a subject matter expert, in all manner of data mining activities (activities include, but are not limited to data analysis, aggregation, business insights, interpretation and recommendation)
  • Investigate industry leading data tools and methods to be leveraged in data mining, analysis & visualization
  • Participate actively in the exchange of knowledge relating to parameter estimation, data, portfolio management and analytical methodology 
  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to
  • Provide data Governance expertise ensuring linkage across all sources and all reporting produced to optimize accuracy, efficiencies and manage redundancies
  • Provide analytical support on Ad Hoc requests originating from various stakeholders 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong credit risk modeling knowledge and good lending products data acumen
  • Strong data manipulation capability and analytical skills with advanced SQL programming skills; experience in SAS/Python or similar tools; expertise with MS Office Suite.
  • Effective and equally conversant in translating technical expertise into business language that drive insights
  • At least 3 years working experience with lending products and related databases
  • Advanced knowledge and working experience with data management and data visualization using tools including Tableau

Nice-to-have

  • Degree in quantitative field of study (e.g. Statistics, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Computer Science) – to demonstrate capability for critical thinking and data analysis
  • Experience in the Financial industry
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment
  • Expertise in navigating an Enterprise Data Warehouse, experience with Hadoop environments, Python, R or other tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, and competitive compensation
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities       
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Flexible work/life balance options

Job Summary

The Associate Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling will support the development and monitoring of RBC’s Retail AIRB (Advanced Internal Ratings Based) regulatory capital parameters from a data analytics and portfolio management perspective.

You will focus on the preparation of the data ingested for modeling Retail parameters: PD/LGD/EAD, and back-testing of the parameter performance. You will assist the Director, Credit Risk Analytics and Modeling in the execution and maintenance of tools and processes that support model development and performance monitoring. You will assist Senior Management and the Board in understanding critical parameter estimation issues relating to credit risk parameters.

We are looking for a bright, committed, high-performing individual to become a key contributor on the data and analytics side of quantitative model development. We are a team that prides itself for high quality work with significant impact across the bank and continuous interaction with other groups, senior management and regulators. item.title: Manager, Data & Analytics - Risk Monitoring
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data & Analytics - Risk Monitoring

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As the Manager, Data & Analytics, you will be responsible for developing tests that provides visibility into the effectiveness of key controls across all LOBs within P&CB. You will also work on streamlining our processes and finding analytical & reporting solutions to enable effective communication of business and operational risk insights.  

Please Note: This role is a hybrid opportunity, for applicants within commuting distance to the 88 Queens Quay office locations.

What will you do?

  • Develop complex Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW) queries to test key risk controls against a business requirements.
  • Coordinate quality assurance and back testing to determine if the rules are working properly
  • Compare output of the data mart to user front end input to find data inconsistencies, and create the distribution analysis of samples pulled to expectations
  • Support verifying data consistency between final reports, source systems, and data input; and assist with researching and enhancing automation methodologies
  • Be a member of the data accuracy committee, where issues are identified, recommendations are discussed, challenged and implemented
  • Produce reports and analysis to enable effective risk management across all LOBs within P&CB.
  • Ensure a framework and governance structure is in place, to maintain key findings, reporting and access to data of file reviews for regulators
  • Partner with teammates to design meaningful risk-monitoring measures for decision making.
  • Provide streamlining solutions for end-to-end operational risk reporting and key control test development.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • 2+ years experience in reporting or analytics and a Degree in a quantitative field
  • Strong expertise in data querying tools and advance skills in SAS, SQL and DataMeer
  • Experienced in using Teradata to query EDW
  • Knowledge of data related to Retail and/or Commercial banking products
  • Proficiency in MS Excel (including Pivot Tables and data importing)
  • Solid communication skills, and ability to effectively converse with technical and non-technical contacts
  • Proven analytical and problem solving experience, with a collaborative attitude

Nice-to-have

  • Experience using DataMeer for ETL jobs
  • Experience building Tableau reports
  • Experience using Python for data analytics and/or automation

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Competitive Compensation
  • A professional and supportive team environment
  • A comprehensive training program on internal processes and systems
  • Career progression if you have what it takes to be the best

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
