item.title: Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Customer Insights, Data & Analytics Product Manager (Ownr)

Job Description

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our mission

What is the opportunity?

Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.

About Ownr

At Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We\'re on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.

 

What you will do

  • Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights
  • Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.
  • Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.
  • Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.
  • Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.
  • Create, manage, and maintain KPI\'s to monitor, analyze and improve conversion
  • Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities
  • Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.
  • Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.
  • Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.
  • Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.
  • Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.
  • Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.

 

Skills you\'ll need to succeed

 Must have

  • Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).
  • Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.
  • Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.
  • Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.
  • In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.
  • Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value
  • Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.
  • Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.
  • A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.
  • Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.
  • Commitment to winning as a team.
  • An entrepreneurial & innovative spirit

 

Nice to have

  • Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub
  • Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and Metabase

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options

 Launching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.

 

We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.

 

VSPRODUCT

RBC Ventures

The data protection team is at the forefront of delivering actionable insider threat and analytics services. Using data science practices tied to web and analytics services it helps highlight actionable events for ongoing investigations.

As the lead developer, you will be accountable for extending and enhancing current application services while working closely with product owners to develop and link together various components with a focus on overall fidelity of data models, optimization, product design and delivering enhancements as part of current managed web analytics services. This opportunity is suitable for someone who is skilled in web application development, motivated, someone who enjoy working on a variety of problems and enhancements, someone who works well in a multi-disciplinary team as well as working independently on key tasks.

item.title: Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Regional Banking Support’s BFS Reporting is hiring a Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management role that will support strategic reporting and visual insights for Regional Banking’s BFS by successfully transforming data into useful, relevant information, and by leveraging sound business knowledge, additional sources of information, and resources to deliver insight to the BFS field.  The position plays a role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders in a BFS banking environment, alongside key technology partners. 

What will you do?

  • Utilize cutting edge business intelligence capabilities to optimize business results, define, measure, and deliver insights and mitigate risk.

  • Design and develop/enhance innovative reporting solutions to monitor performance management, present key analytical and business insights to underlying drivers in support of the BFS advisors and leaders on client and coaching insights to drive an exceptional client experience.

  • Take end to end responsibility in the development and enhancement of performance metrics and reporting in Tableau.

  • Respond to ad-hoc investigations, inquiries, data, and report requests as assigned.

  • Run production jobs as assigned.

  • Demonstrate Subject Matter Expertise in data and reporting infrastructure design, configuration and optimization, providing recommendations on approach and execution.

  • Apply standard design principles and data visualization techniques to measure key indicators, disclose trends, provide proactive actionable insights/indicators and address business questions.

  • Identify appropriate data sources and perform Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) for data modelling, data quality assessments, understand patterns and provide the basis to inform the reporting solution which provides meaningful performance management insights.

  • Participate in conversations with internal partners to understand their business strategies (role design, incentive, practice management and portfolio quality) and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction.

  • Participate in design and solution review demonstrations with the Senior Manager and/or internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications.

  • Test and validate (QA) new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements.

  • Enhance and optimize existing production processes.  

  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases.

  • Be a thought partner within the BFS Reporting team, supporting the developments of insights, processes, data approaches/ methodologies and information that is valued by partners across Regional Banking and BFS.

  • Learn on a consistent basis, be adaptable to change due to re-prioritizing of items.

       

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent related experience.

  • Demonstrated ETL and big data modeling capabilities, with programming experience in large databases/datasets and using SAS, SQL Server and Teradata SQL Assistant.

  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining.

  • Proficient in SQL extracts in order to investigate data from data warehouse and other sources (flat files) for investigation/analysis purposes.

  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders in order to inform of strategic decisions.

  • Proven quantitative analytical (including data knowledge, data discovery, data aggregation and summarization) and problem solving skills.

  • UNIX knowledge (i.e. submit process, create logs, store data).

  • Advanced in developing reports using Tableau.

  • Data knowledge on RBC’s EDW.

  • Be skilled in Microsoft applications (Excel, PowerPoint).

  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience.

Nice-to-have

  • Financial Services Industry/Business Financial Services knowledge

  • Experience in developing performance metrics/reports

  • Programming/coding skills in Python and Hadoop (HIVE) and Datameer

  • Experience with Tableau Security, Tableau Server Administration

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Regional Banking Support’s BFS Reporting is hiring a Senior Manager, Business Intelligence & Information Management role that will lead strategic reporting and visual insights for Regional Banking’s BFS by successfully transforming data into useful, relevant information, and by leveraging sound business knowledge, additional sources of information, and resources to deliver insight to the BFS field.  The position plays a leadership role in driving strategic, timely, and accurate insights to business partners and senior leaders in a BFS banking environment, alongside key technology partners. 

What will you do?

  • Utilize cutting edge business intelligence capabilities to optimize business results, define, measure, and deliver insights and mitigate risk
  • Design and develop innovative reporting solutions to monitor performance management, present key analytical and business insights to underlying drivers in support of the BFS advisors and leaders on client and coaching insights to drive an exceptional client experience
  • Take end to end responsibility in the development of performance metrics and reporting in Tableau
  • Demonstrate Subject Matter Expertise in data and reporting infrastructure design, configuration and optimization, providing recommendations on approach and execution
  • Apply standard design principles and advanced data visualization techniques to measure key indicators, disclose trends, provide proactive actionable insights/indicators and address business questions
  • Identify appropriate data sources and perform Extract/Transform/Load (ETL) for data modelling, data quality assessments, understand patterns and provide the basis to inform the reporting solution which provides meaningful performance management insights
  • Lead discussions with internal partners to understand their business strategies (role design, incentive, practice management and portfolio quality) and objectives in order to define/recommend reporting solutions to meet those objectives, effectively communicate project status and develop relationships to ensure satisfaction
  • Lead the design and solution review demonstrations with internal partners at critical tollgates to ensure adherence to requirements, resolve obstacles, while mitigating deployment risk and the need for post-deployment modifications
  • Test and validate (unit testing) new and existing reports and analytics for adherence to business and technical requirements
  • Create and maintain accurate documentation related to reporting solutions, including specifications, data lineage, technical and business definitions for metrics, and test plan/test cases
  • Be a thought partner within the BFS Reporting team, supporting the developments of insights, processes, data approaches/ methodologies and information that is valued by partners across Regional Banking and BFS

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

  • Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics/Statistics, Engineering, related field or equivalent related experience
  • Experience in statistical methods, strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to senior leaders in order to inform strategic decisions
  • Demonstrated ETL and big data modeling capabilities, with programming experience in large databases/datasets and using SAS, SQL Server and Teradata SQL Assistant
  • Advanced proficiency in developing reports using Tableau
  • Deep data knowledge on RBC’s EDW
  • Experience on data extract/ingestion against EDL
  • Have worked in an Agile Lab
  • UNIX knowledge (i.e. submit process, create logs, store data)
  • Proven quantitative analytical and problem solving skills
  • Expert technical documentation skills and the ability to effectively communicate, verbally and in writing, technical concepts to a non-technical audience

Nice-to-have

  • Financial Services Industry/Business Financial Services knowledge
  • Experience in developing performance metrics/reports
  • Programming/coding skills in Python and Hadoop (HIVE) and Datameer
  • Strong understanding of Cloud computing technologies

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: Client Intelligence Associate - Data Visualization (Tableau)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Client Intelligence Associate - Data Visualization (Tableau)

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The Capital Markets Client Intelligence team is responsible for producing client, sales and business analytics to enable the businesses we support to effectively monitor performance and make informed business decisions. Our team works closely with the Sales & Trading and Corporate & Investment Banking divisions to design and produce KPIs that track business performance and the success of our firm’s key strategic initiatives. In addition to delivering best-in-class analytics, the team partners closely with technology to enhance our client analytics tools. Recognized as data stewards for the firm, the Client Intelligence team is tasked with identifying strategic data initiatives and leads cross-functional efforts to address data integrity and completeness issues.

What will you do?

  • Provide data, reporting and analytics support to business stakeholders and senior leadership

  • Integrate various data sources (internal metrics, client wallet data, qualitative feedback) to create insightful business analytics produce actionable client insights

  • Leverage competitive benchmarking information to identify opportunities to deepen client relationships, better focus sales efforts and drive revenue uplift

  • Partner with stakeholders to support the buildout of a holistic and consistent view of client profitability across RBC

  • Participate in the client planning process for Capital Markets and track actual to plan performance for senior management

  • Consistently look for ways to automate existing manual processes, driving change management to improve processes, accuracy of data & reporting, and efficiencies

  • Support data validation and participate in UAT for technology enhancements to our analytics platforms

  • Look for ways to improve our client technology platforms; partner with stakeholders and technology to increase the effectiveness of our analytics platforms

 

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:

  • Bachelor’s degree or higher; at least 2 years of work experience in data, analytics and/or reporting

  • Positive attitude and collaborative approach

  • Strong written & verbal communication skills; ability to communicate confidently

  • Ability to multi-task and manage multiple initiatives and competing priorities at once

  • Influencing skills; ability to build relationships with key internal stakeholders and partners

  • Self-starter, ability to progress and deliver initiatives with little direction / oversight

  • Ambitious & driven; doesn’t settle for status quo and consistently looks for ways to improve

  • Demonstrated ability to organize large amounts of data and effectively present metrics and analysis

  • Proficiency in data & reporting tools (i.e., Qlik, Sisense, Tableau, SQL, Python or other)

  • Advanced proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, charts & graphs)

Nice to have:

  • Capital Markets experience, knowledge of Global Markets products (Fixed Income, FX, Commodities, Futures and Equities) or Corporate & Investment Banking businesses

  • Experience working in a trading floor environment with the ability to manage expectations in a fast paced environment

  • Experience and ability to effectively communicate to senior management in a concise manner

  • Strong presentation skills, ability to effectively convey messaging

  • Ability to synthesize large amounts of information to key takeaways and themes for senior management

  • Strong influencing skills and the ability to effectuate change

  • Experience in supporting senior leadership teams

  • Proficiency in Confluence, SharePoint, PowerPoint

 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Opportunities to do challenging work and take on greater responsibilities

  • Access to leaders who support your development through coaching and mentoring opportunities

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same.  Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

item.title: Director – Agile Program Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director – Agile Program Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity? 

As part of Chief Data Office, Enterprise Client Data & Functions Data Domain team, Director – Agile Program Management is a key role, who leads, directs and oversees activities on planning, delivery and implementation to accomplish enterprise wide strategic goals and objectives. You will drive all the program processes and execution associated with the RBC scaled Agile Management Framework (AMF) and hold the overall responsibility for all the processes and people involved in the product deliveries within the Agile Release train (ART) driving continuous improvement. You will help drive RBC`s data ambition to next generation enablement and innovation, with  particular focus on program and project delivery by cultivating strategic relationships with business, technology & digital partners. You will provide professional and strategic leadership with a focus on delivering value and expected outcomes, promoting a data centric culture to build rich shared data assets and deliver insight-rich offerings.

What will you do?

Initiatives Delivery

  • Support Enterprise Client Data & Functions Data Domain in the execution of Data Management and Analytics proof of concepts and initiatives by translating the project vision into program high level scope, design and executables
  • Liaise with partners to deliver enterprise-level strategic & regulatory initiatives and to establish & maintain capabilities (data quality, data analytics and data product delivery)
  • Establish data squads of product owners, data engineers & data modelers with end to end accountability and oversees multiple projects to drive effective outcomes
  • Work closely with partners, product owners and engineering teams to influence org goals, product vision, roadmap, planning and backlog prioritization
  • Lead high visibility, cross-team strategic initiatives including scoping, requirement gathering, design, implementation and launch phases
  • Prioritize the portfolio of data products & services to be launched and ensure on-time, on-budget completion of project managing risk
  • Manage the overall product delivery & support budget ensuring the best possible return on investment for the client
  • Ensure timely completion of all internal project management reports including milestones, financial forecast, resource forecast, status and other reports

Governance and Compliance

  • Operationalize governance and oversight for the Agile Release Train
  • Ensure agile delivery teams comply with RBC governance and risk management process as outlined in the Agile Management Framework
  • Ensure all compliance documents are completed and executives received this in a timely manner for review and sign-off  E.g. Integrated Risk profile, Agile Program SoW
  • Ensure that the teams are correctly using tools necessary to support collection of program / organizational metrics

People Leadership & Relationship Management

  • Influence employee commitment to the organization, to the team and to their role by creating an E2E approach to delivery, establishing a product mindset and setting appropriate context when assigning work to individuals
  • Build team and individual capabilities by providing development opportunities
  • Build strong, collaborative and trusted relationships with business, technology and digital stakeholders across the enterprise and third parties
  • Act as an advocate for CDO, sharing CDO`s mission, vision & strategic goals, influence partners to recognize the value of these goals and align requests accordingly
  • Manage expectations of multiple business stakeholders and solve for challenges such as conflicting priorities, resistance to change & sub-optimal communication across teams

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Minimum 8+ years of industry experience with an undergraduate degree
  • Minimum 3+ years of program management experience (as an Agile program lead or Sr. Scrum Master) working on complex initiatives, orchestrating work across a multi team environment
  • Ability to apply RBC Agile Management Framework and well documented Agile techniques (User Stories, Burndown techniques, Acceptance Test Driven Development, Continuous testing, etc.); application of the scaled agile framework (SAFe) and the launch of agile release train
  • Thorough understanding and experience with Data Analytics Development Lifecycle and available tools, methods, concepts and techniques
  • Ability to manage complexity well and coordinate information and activities among groups with differing agendas, across multi-functional areas.
  • Ability to develop and maintain a network of relationships with key influencers including business partners, peers, industry colleagues etc.
  • Demonstrated Leadership ability with experience and proficiency in communicating complex subject matters to business and IT executives

Nice-to-have

  • Prior experience in Financial Services
  • Prior experience in  Data Transformation, implementation of a Data Platform, Stewardship, Data analytics and Reporting skills
  • Certified Scrum Master, Scrum Master Trainer, Certified Scrum Professional, Certified Scrum Product Owner, or SAFe Agilist is highly desirable

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
